definition: chisel/to bore a hole/to chisel or dig/(literary) (bound form) certain/authentic/irrefutable/also pr. [zuo4]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: A hold created with a hamer and chisel by a moron uncapable of doing the climb as it is.
sentences.chinese: 用锤子或凿子凿出来的把手点，是一种低能的行为。

sentences.english: He selected the right chisels from a pile laid out beside him.
sentences.chinese: 他从摊在身边的一堆凿子中挑出适用的几把。

sentences.english: A unique method of using the hammer and chisel.
sentences.chinese: 锤子和凿子的独特的使用方法。

sentences.english: They broke through the skull by using a chisel.
Taper the plug off a bit with a chisel so that it will sit into the hole.
sentences.chinese: 用凿子把这塞子一头削尖点，使它能塞进孔里。

sentences.english: He is chipping away at a block marble with a chisel.
sentences.chinese: 他正在用凿子在大理石上不停地凿。

sentences.english: The workmen quarried out a huge block of marble.
sentences.chinese: 他连续用凿子凿一块大理石。

sentences.english: Concentrate on the place where the chisel cuts while hammering.
sentences.chinese: 锤击凿子时，视线应该集中凿切的地方。

sentences.english: A hammer and chisel are used for the first stages of contouring a surface.
sentences.chinese: 第一阶段使用锤子和凿子画大样。

sentences.english: He broke away the veneer with a chisel.
sentences.chinese: 他用凿子把胶合板拆开。

definition: a saw/to cut with a saw
chisel/to bore a hole/to chisel or dig/(literary) (bound form) certain/authentic/irrefutable/also pr. [zuo4]
carpenter's straight line marker (an inked cord stretched tight then lowered onto timber)
